result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah A Haerterich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count # 1, the Court sentences Ms. Haerterich to pay a fine of $250 plus costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, and to pay court-appointed attorney fees.   Ms. Haerterich is to continue on the already-established payment plan of $50 per month to pay the entirety of the amount due.
***PER 6-12-17 ORDER for payment of attorney fees in the amount of $203***
--The Court orders Ms. Haeterich to comply with DNA sample provision as required by law.

[MK] case called at 3:57pm. 
Defendant Sarah A Haerterich in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Jeffery Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2;  further, the Court reads in an uncharged referral for Obstructing An Office on 8/20/20116 (DA Case #16JE2484) and thereafter bars further prosecution of this referral).  

On Count # 1, the Court sentences Ms. Haerterich to pay a fine of $250 plus costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, and to pay court-appointed attorney fees.   Ms. Haerterich is to continue on the already-established payment plan of $50 per month to pay the entirety of the amount due.  
The Court orders Ms. Haeterich to comply with DNA sample provision as required by law.  
recess 4:00pm.

NEXT: a time-to-pay slip was not provided to Ms. Haerterich at this hearing; after the total due has been determined, the Bookkeeping Department is asked to please mail Ms. Haerterich information on the amount due and the payment plan

[MK] case called at 1:44pm. 
Defendant Sarah A Haerterich appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond purposes).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel is given.  
Ms. Haeterich verifies that the date of birth listed on the Complaint is correct;  Ms. Haeterich provides an updated address in Marshall.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:48pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/5/16 at 2:00pm,  (2) Status Conference on 11/4/16 at 9:00am
